h5401.definition: a primitive root (identical with {{h5400}}, through the idea of fastening up; compare {{h2388}}, {{h2836}}); to kiss, literally or figuratively (touch); also (as a mode of attachment), to equip with weapons; armed (men), rule, kiss, that touched.

h5402.definition: or נֵשֶׁק; from {{h5401}}; military equipment, i.e. (collectively) arms (offensive or defensive), or (concretely) an arsenal; armed men, armour(-y), battle, harness, weapon.

h5404.definition: from an unused root meaning to lacerate; the eagle (or other large bird of prey); eagle.

h5405.definition: a primitive root; properly, to eliminate, i.e. (intransitively) to dry up; fail.

h5406.definition: probably of Persian origin; an epistle; letter.

h5408.definition: a primitive root; to dismember; cut (in pieces), divide, hew in pieces.

h5410.definition: or (feminine) נְתִיבָה; or נְתִבָה; (Jeremiah 6:16), from an unused root meaning to tramp; a (beaten) track; path(-way), × travel(-ler), way.

h5411.definition: or נָתוּן (Ezra 8:17), (the proper form as passive participle), from {{h5414}}; one given, i.e. (in the plural only); the Nethinim, or Temple-servants (as given to that duty); Nethinims.

h5413.definition: a primitive root; to flow forth (literally or figuratively); by implication, to liquify; drop, gather (together), melt, pour (forth, out).

h5414.definition: a primitive root; to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.); add, apply, appoint, ascribe, assign, × avenge, × be (healed), bestow, bring (forth, hither), cast, cause, charge, come, commit, consider, count,   cry, deliver (up), direct, distribute, do, × doubtless, × without fail, fasten, frame, × get, give (forth, over, up), grant, hang (up), × have, × indeed, lay (unto charge, up), (give) leave, lend, let (out),   lie, lift up, make,   O that, occupy, offer, ordain, pay, perform, place, pour, print, × pull, put (forth), recompense, render, requite, restore, send (out), set (forth), shew, shoot forth (up),   sing,   slander, strike, (sub-) mit, suffer, × surely, × take, thrust, trade, turn, utter,   weep,   willingly,   withdraw,   would (to) God, yield.

h5415.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h5414}}; give; bestow, give pay.

h5416.definition: from {{h5414}}; given; Nathan, the name of five Israelites; Nathan.

h5417.definition: from {{h5414}} and {{h410}}; given of God; Nethanel, the name of ten Israelites; Nethaneel.

h5418.definition: or נְתַנְיָהוּ; from {{h5414}} and {{h3050}}; given of Jah; Nethanjah, the name of four Israelites; Nethaniah.

h5419.definition: from {{h5414}} and {{h4428}}; given of (the) king; Nethan-Melek, an Israelite; Nathanmelech.

h5420.definition: a primitive root; to tear up; mar.

h5422.definition: a primitive root; to tear down; beat down, break down (out), cast down, destroy, overthrow, pull down, throw down.

h5423.definition: a primitive root; to tear off; break (off), burst, draw (away), lift up, pluck (away, off), pull (out), root out.

h5425.definition: a primitive root; to jump, i.e. be violently agitated; causatively, to terrify, shake off, untie; drive asunder, leap, (let) loose, × make, move, undo.

h5427.definition: from {{h5425}}; mineral potash (so called from effervescing with acid); nitre.

h5428.definition: a primitive root; to tear away; destroy, forsake, pluck (out, up, by the roots), pull up, root out (up), × utterly. s

h5429.definition: from an unused root meaning to define; a seah, or certain measure (as determinative) for grain; measure.

h5430.definition: from {{h5431}}; perhaps a military boot (as a protection from mud); battle.

h5431.definition: a primitive root; to be miry; used only as denominative from {{h5430}}; to shoe, i.e. (active participle) a soldier shod; warrior.

h5433.definition: a primitive root; to quaff to satiety, i.e. become tipsy; drunkard, fill self, Sabean, (wine-) bibber.

h5434.definition: of foreign origin; Seba, a son of Cush, and the country settled by him; Seba.

h5435.definition: from {{h5433}}; potation, concretely (wine), or abstractly (carousal); drink, drunken, wine.

h5436.definition: patrial from {{h5434}}; a Sebaite, or inhabitant of Seba; Sabean.

h5437.definition: a primitive root; to revolve, surround, or border; used in various applications, literally and figuratively; bring, cast, fetch, lead, make, walk, × whirl, × round about, be about on every side, apply, avoid, beset (about), besiege, bring again, carry (about), change, cause to come about, × circuit, (fetch a) compass (about, round), drive, environ, × on every side, beset (close, come, compass, go, stand) round about, inclose, remove, return, set, sit down, turn (self) (about, aside, away, back).

h5439.definition: or (feminine) סְבִיבָה; from {{h5437}}; (as noun) a circle, neighbour, or environs; but chiefly (as adverb, with or without preposition) around; (place, round) about, circuit, compass, on every side.

h5440.definition: a primitive root; to entwine; fold together, wrap.

h5443.definition: (Aramaic) or שַׂבְּכָא; (Aramaic), from a root corresponding to {{h5440}}; a lyre; sackbut.

h5444.definition: from {{h5440}}; copse-like; Sibbecai, an Israelite; Sibbecai, Sibbechai.

h5445.definition: a primitive root; to carry (literally or figuratively), or (reflexively) be burdensome; specifically, to be gravid; bear, be a burden, carry, strong to labour.

h5446.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h5445}}; to erect; strongly laid.

h5447.definition: from {{h5445}}; a load (literally or figuratively); burden, charge.

h5448.definition: (only in the form סֻבָּל; from {{h5445}}; load (figuratively); burden.

h5449.definition: from {{h5445}}; a porter; (to bear, bearer of) burden(-s).

h5451.definition: for {{h7641}}; an ear of grain; Sibboleth.

h5452.definition: (Aramaic) a primitive root; to bear in mind, i.e. hope; think.

h5453.definition: dual from a root corresponding to {{h5452}}; double hope; Sibrajim, a place in Syria; Sibraim.

h5454.definition: or סַבְתָּה; probably of foreign derivation; Sabta or Sabtah, the name of a son of Cush, and the country occupied by his posterity; Sabta, Sabtah.

h5455.definition: probably of foreign derivation; Sabteca, the name of a son of Cush, and the region settled by him; Sabtecha, Sabtechah.

h5456.definition: a primitive root; to prostrate oneself (in homage); fall down.

h5458.definition: from {{h5462}}; properly, shut up, i.e. the breast (as enclosing the heart); also gold (as generally shut up safely); caul, gold.

h5459.definition: feminine passive participle of an unused root meaning to shut up; wealth (as closely shut up); jewel, peculiar (treasure), proper good, special.

h5461.definition: from an unused root meaning to superintend; a præfect of a province; prince, ruler.

h5462.definition: a primitive root; to shut up; figuratively, to surrender; close up, deliver (up), give over (up), inclose, × pure, repair, shut (in, self, out, up, up together), stop, × straitly.

h5464.definition: probably from {{h5462}} in the sense of sweeping away; a pouring rain; very rainy.

h5465.definition: from an unused root meaning to stop; the stocks; stocks.

h5466.definition: from an unused root meaning to envelop; a wrapper, i.e. shirt; fine linen, sheet.

h5467.definition: from an unused root meaning to scorch; burnt (i.e. volcanic or bituminous) district; Sedom, a place near the Dead Sea; Sodom.

h5468.definition: from an unused root meaning to arrange; order; order.

h5469.definition: from an unused root meaning to be round; roundness; round.

h5470.definition: from the same as {{h5469}}; a dungeon (as surrounded by walls); prison.

h5471.definition: of foreign derivation; So, an Egyptian king; So.

h5472.definition: a primitive root; properly, to flinch, i.e. (by implication) to go back, literally (to retreat) or figuratively (to apostatize); backslider, drive, go back, turn (away, back).

h5473.definition: a primitive root (probably rather identical with {{h5472}} through the idea of shrinking from a hedge; compare {{h7735}}); to hem in, i.e. bind; set about.

h5474.definition: from {{h5462}}; an inclosure, i.e. cage (for an animal); ward.

h5475.definition: from {{h3245}}; a session, i.e. company of persons (in close deliberation); by implication, intimacy, consultation, a secret; assembly, consel, inward, secret (counsel).

h5476.definition: from {{h5475}}; a confidant; Sodi, an Israelite; Sodi.

h5477.definition: from an unused root meaning to wipe away; sweeping; Suach, an Israelite; Suah.

h5478.definition: from the same as {{h5477}}; something swept away, i.e. filth; torn.

h5479.definition: from {{h7750}}; roving; Sotai, one of the Nethinim; Sotai.

h5480.definition: a primitive root; properly, to smear over (with oil), i.e. anoint; anoint (self), × at all.

h5481.definition: (Aramaic) or סוּמְפֹּנְיָה; (Aramaic), or סִיפֹנְיָא; (Daniel 3:10) (Aramaic), of Greek origin; a bagpipe (with a double pipe); dulcimer.

h5482.definition: (rather to be written סְוֵנָה; for סְוֵן; i.e to Seven); of Egyptian derivation; Seven, a place in Upper Egypt; Syene.

h5483.definition: or סֻס; from an unused root meaning to skip (properly, for joy); a horse (as leaping); also a swallow (from its rapid flight); crane, horse (-back, -hoof). Compare {{h6571}}.

h5484.definition: feminine of {{h5483}}; a mare; company of horses.

h5485.definition: from {{h5483}}; horse-like; Susi, an Israelite; Susi.

h5486.definition: a primitive root; to snatch away, i.e. terminate; consume, have an end, perish, × be utterly.

h5487.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h5486}}; to come to an end; consume, fulfill.

h5488.definition: probably of Egyptian origin; a reed, especially the papyrus; flag, Red (sea), weed. Compare {{h5489}}.

h5489.definition: for {{h5488}} (by ellipsis of {{h3220}}); the Reed (Sea); Red Sea.

h5490.definition: from {{h5486}}; a termination; conclusion, end, hinder participle

h5492.definition: from {{h5486}}; a hurricane; Red Sea, storm, tempest, whirlwind, Red sea.

h5493.definition: or שׂוּר; (Hosea 9:12), a primitive root; to turn off (literally or figuratively); be(-head), bring, call back, decline, depart, eschew, get (you), go (aside), × grievous, lay away (by), leave undone, be past, pluck away, put (away, down), rebel, remove (to and fro), revolt, × be sour, take (away, off), turn (aside, away, in), withdraw, be without.

h5494.definition: probably passive participle of {{h5493}}; turned off, i.e. deteriorated; degenerate.

h5495.definition: the same as {{h5494}}; Sur, a gate of the temple; Sur.

h5496.definition: perhaps denominative from {{h7898}}; properly, to prick, i.e. (figuratively) stimulate; by implication, to seduce; entice, move, persuade, provoke, remove, set on, stir up, take away.

h5497.definition: probably from the same root as {{h4533}}; covering, i.e. clothing; clothes.

h5498.definition: a primitive root; to trail along; draw (out), tear.

h5500.definition: a primitive root; to sweep away; scrape.
